tags.name: nord-button
tags.description:
Buttons are used for interface actions. Primary style should be
used only once per section for main call-to-action, while other
styles can appear more frequently.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The style variant of the button.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the button.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
The size of the button.
This affects font-size and padding.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
When provided, renders the button as a link,
with its href attribute set to the given value.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description:
When provided together with a href property, the button will
trigger a file download instead of a page visit.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
When provided together with a href property, determines where
to open the linked URL. The keywords have special meanings for
where to load the URL: “_self” means the current browsing context,
“_blank” usually a new tab but users can configure browsers this to
open a new window instead, “_parent” means the parent browsing
context of the current one, but if no parent exists, behaves as
_self, and finally “top” means the topmost browsing context.

attributes.name: expand
attributes.description: Controls whether the button expands to fill the width of its container.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description:
Controls whether the button is in loading state. Please note that the spinner
is hidden from assistive technologies, so you need to make sure to announce
the loading state to e.g. screen reader users. We also recommend disabling
all user interactions on the button itself while in loading state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
Makes the component disabled. This prevents users from
being able to interact with the component, and conveys
its inactive state to assistive technologies.

attributes.description: The name of the form component.

attributes.description: The value of the form component.

tags.name: nord-calendar
tags.description:
Calendar allows user to pick a date. It comes with built-in
functionality that allows you to set a minimum and a maximum allowed date.
Please note that the date must be passed in ISO-8601 format.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The selected date on the calendar. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.

attributes.name: firstDayOfWeek
attributes.description:
Which day is considered first day of the week? `0` for Sunday, `1` for Monday, etc.
Default is Monday.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description:
Minimum date allowed to be picked. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
This setting can be used alone or together with the max property.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description:
Maximum date allowed to be picked. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
This setting can be used alone or together with the min property.

attributes.name: expand
attributes.description: Controls whether the calendar expands to fill the width of its container.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The selected date on the calendar. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.

properties.name: firstDayOfWeek
properties.description:
Which day is considered first day of the week? `0` for Sunday, `1` for Monday, etc.
Default is Monday.

properties.name: min
properties.description:
Minimum date allowed to be picked. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
This setting can be used alone or together with the max property.

properties.name: max
properties.description:
Maximum date allowed to be picked. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
This setting can be used alone or together with the min property.

properties.name: expand
properties.description: Controls whether the calendar expands to fill the width of its container.

properties.name: isDateDisabled
properties.description:
Controls which days are disabled and therefore disallowed.
For example, this can be used to disallow selection of weekends.

properties.name: isDateHighlighted
properties.description:
Controls which days are highlighted with a small indicator.
Returning a "falsy" value will not show an indicator.
Returning "truthy" value will show the indicator, but without an accessible label.
Returning a string will show the indicator, and use the string as accessible label.
It is recommended to return a string rather than a truthy value whenever possible.

events.name: change
events.description: Dispatched when a date is selected and the value changes.

events.name: nord-focus-date
events.description: Dispatched when the calendar's focused date changes.

cssProperties.name: --n-calendar-border-radius
cssProperties.default: "var(--n-border-radius)] - Controls how rounded the corners are, using [border radius tokens"

cssProperties.name: --n-calendar-box-shadow
cssProperties.default: "var(--n-box-shadow-popout)] - Controls the surrounding shadow, using [box shadow tokens"

tags.name: nord-dropdown
tags.description:
Dropdown menu displays a list of actions or selectable options for
a user. Dropdown uses popout component internally to create
the overlay functionality.

attributes.name: expand
attributes.description: Controls whether the toggle slot expands to fill the width of its container.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
The size of the dropdown. This affects the minimum and maximum inline-size
of the dropdown.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Controls whether the component is open or not.

attributes.name: align
attributes.description:
Set the alignment in relation to the toggle (or anchor) depending on the position.
`start` will align it to the left of the toggle (or anchor).
`end` will align it to the right of the toggle (or anchor).
Setting the `position` to `inline-start` or `inline-end` will switch
`start` and `end` to the top and bottom respectively.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description:
Set the position in relation to the toggle (or anchor).
Options follow logical properties.
`block-start` and `block-end` referring to top and bottom respectively,
`inline-start` and `inline-end` referring to left and right respectively.

properties.name: shadowRootOptions
properties.description:
we delegate focus, to ensure focus does not move to body if you click
some whitespace or a dropdown-group heading, as this would close the dropdown
properties.type: { delegatesFocus: boolean; mode: ShadowRootMode; slotAssignment?: SlotAssignmentMode | undefined; }

tags.description:
Empty state can be used when there is no data to display to
describe what the user can do next. Empty state provides

tags.name: nord-fieldset

It is necessary to use a fieldset with radio and checkbox components.
It can also be useful for logically grouping other types of inputs.

A fieldset marked as required will be announced as such to users of assistive technology.
When using this property you need to also set “novalidate” attribute on a form element to prevent browser from displaying its own validation errors.

required attribute to assistive technologies like screen readers.

tags.name: nord-header

viewed context as well as providing primary actions.

tags.name: nord-icon

tags.name: nord-input

Inputs are used to allow users to provide text input when the expected input is short.
As well as plain text, Input supports various types of text, including passwords and numbers.

tags.name: nord-layout
tags.description:
Layout component is used to create the main layout of an app. Layout
currently comes with one main configuration: two-column.

attributes.name: nav-open
attributes.description:
Controls whether the navigation is hidden off-screen or not.
Defaults to `true` for wide viewports, and `false` otherwise.

attributes.name: nav-toggle
attributes.description:
ID reference of element used to toggle the navigation.
This is deprecated, the layout component will now render its own nav toggle to simplify usage.

attributes.name: padding
attributes.description:
Controls the padding of the default main section slot. When set to “none”,
the nav and header slots will still have padding.

attributes.name: sticky
attributes.description: Controls whether the layout's header has sticky positioning.

properties.name: navOpen
properties.description:
Controls whether the navigation is hidden off-screen or not.
Defaults to `true` for wide viewports, and `false` otherwise.

properties.name: navToggle
properties.description:
ID reference of element used to toggle the navigation.
This is deprecated, the layout component will now render its own nav toggle to simplify usage.

properties.name: padding
properties.description:
Controls the padding of the default main section slot. When set to “none”,
the nav and header slots will still have padding.

properties.name: sticky
properties.description: Controls whether the layout's header has sticky positioning.

slots.description: The default main section content.

slots.name: nav
slots.description: Used to place content inside the navigation sidebar.

slots.name: header
slots.description: Used to place content inside the header section.

slots.name: drawer
slots.description: Used to place additional content/details relating to a selected item.

slots.name: nav-toggle
slots.description: Used to place a own nav-toggle component, for cases where you might need to add a tooltip.

cssProperties.name: --n-layout-padding
cssProperties.default: "var(--n-space-l)] - Controls the padding around the main layout area (the main slot), using our [spacing tokens"

cssProperties.name: --n-layout-drawer-inline-size
cssProperties.description: Controls the width of the drawer area, when used.

cssProperties.name: --n-layout-background-color
cssProperties.default: "var(--n-color-background)] - Controls the background color of the layout, using [color tokens"

tags.name: nord-modal
tags.description:
Modal component is used to display content that temporarily blocks interactions
with the main view of an application. Modal should be used sparingly and
only when necessary.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Controls whether the modal is open or not.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Controls the max-width of the modal when open.

attributes.name: scrollable
attributes.description:
By default if a modal is too big for the browser window,
the entire modal will scroll. This setting changes that behavior
so that the body of the modal scrolls instead, with the modal
itself remaining fixed.

properties.name: shadowRootOptions
properties.type: { delegatesFocus: boolean; mode: ShadowRootMode; slotAssignment?: SlotAssignmentMode | undefined; }

properties.name: open
properties.description: Controls whether the modal is open or not.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Controls the max-width of the modal when open.

properties.name: returnValue
properties.description:
The reason why the modal was closed. This typically indicates
which button the user pressed to close the modal, though any value
can be supplied if the modal is programmatically closed.

properties.name: scrollable
properties.description:
By default if a modal is too big for the browser window,
the entire modal will scroll. This setting changes that behavior
so that the body of the modal scrolls instead, with the modal
itself remaining fixed.

events.name: cancel
events.description: Dispatched before the modal has closed when a user attempts to dismiss a modal. Call `preventDefault()` on the event to prevent the modal closing.

events.name: close
events.description: Dispatched when a modal is closed for any reason.

slots.description: Default slot

slots.name: header
slots.description: Slot which holds the header of the modal, positioned next to the close button.

slots.name: footer
slots.description: Slot which is typically used to hold call to action buttons, but can also be used to build custom footers.

cssProperties.name: --n-modal-padding-inline
cssProperties.default: "var(--n-space-m)] - Controls the padding on the sides of the modal, using our [spacing tokens"

cssProperties.name: --n-modal-padding-block
cssProperties.default: "var(--n-space-m)] - Controls the padding above and below the modal, using our [spacing tokens"

cssProperties.name: --n-modal-max-inline-size
cssProperties.description: Controls the width of the modal.

tags.name: nord-nav-group

group and is used for grouping items into related categories.

attributes.name: heading

properties.name: heading
properties.description: Heading and accessible label for the nav group

slots.description: The default slot used for the nav items.

tags.name: nord-nav-item
tags.description:
Navigation item populates sidebar navigation with links.
Every item should be placed inside a navigation group.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description:
Used for indicating the current page. This gives a prominent background to the nav item,
and marks the item as the current page for assistive technology.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: The name of an icon from Nordicons to display for the nav item.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
The url the nav item should link to.
Note: this is not used if you have nested navigation using the "subnav" slot.

attributes.name: badge
attributes.description: Allows you to add a notification badge with a number next to the nav item.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description:
When the nav items contains a subnav, controls whether the section is expanded or not.
Note: this is only used if you have nested navigation using the "subnav" slot.

and marks the item as the current page for assistive technology.

properties.description:
When the nav items contains a subnav, controls whether the section is expanded or not.
Note: this is only used if you have nested navigation using the "subnav" slot.

events.name: toggle
events.description: Dispatched whenever a nav item's state changes between open and closed.

slots.description: The default slot used for the nav item's text.

slots.name: subnav
slots.description: Used for nesting navigation. When used the nav-item becomes a button to collapse the subnav, rather than a link.

tags.name: nord-nav-toggle
tags.description:
Nav toggle is meant for hiding and showing the primary navigation.
This component is used internally in the Layout component, but can also be
used separate to further customize the behaviour.

tags.name: nord-navigation
tags.description:
Navigation is used to display the primary navigation in the sidebar
of an application. Navigation includes a list of links that users
use to move between sections of the application.

slots.description: The main section of the sidebar, for holding nav components.

slots.name: header
slots.description: The top section of the sidebar.

slots.name: footer
slots.description: The bottom section of the sidebar.

tags.name: nord-popout
tags.description: Popouts are small overlays that open on demand. They let users access additional content and actions without cluttering the page.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The id for the active element to reference via aria-controls.

attributes.name: anchor
attributes.description: Set an optional anchor element to align against, replacing the triggering element.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Controls whether the component is open or not.

attributes.name: align
attributes.description:
Set the alignment in relation to the toggle (or anchor) depending on the position.
`start` will align it to the left of the toggle (or anchor).
`end` will align it to the right of the toggle (or anchor).
Setting the `position` to `inline-start` or `inline-end` will switch
`start` and `end` to the top and bottom respectively.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description:
Set the position in relation to the toggle (or anchor).
Options follow logical properties.
`block-start` and `block-end` referring to top and bottom respectively,
`inline-start` and `inline-end` referring to left and right respectively.

tags.name: nord-progress-bar
tags.description:
Progress Bar is used to visually represent the completion
of a task or process. It shows how much of the task has
been completed and how much is still left.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
Specifies how much of the task has been completed. Must be a valid floating
point number between 0 and max, or between 0 and 100 if max is omitted. If
there is no value, the progress bar is indeterminate; this indicates that
an activity is ongoing with no indication of how long it’s expected to take.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description:
Describes how much work the task indicated by the progress element requires.
The max attribute, if present, must have a value greater than 0 and be a
valid floating point number.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
Accessible label for the progress indicator. Visually hidden, but shown
for assistive technology.

properties.description:

point number between 0 and max, or between 0 and 100 if max is omitted. If
there is no value, the progress bar is indeterminate; this indicates that
an activity is ongoing with no indication of how long it’s expected to take.

properties.name: max
properties.description:
Describes how much work the task indicated by the progress element requires.
The max attribute, if present, must have a value greater than 0 and be a
valid floating point number.

properties.name: label
properties.description:
Accessible label for the progress indicator. Visually hidden, but shown
for assistive technology.

cssProperties.default: "var(--n-space-s)] - Controls the thickness of the progress bar, using our [spacing tokens"

cssProperties.name: --n-progress-border-radius
cssProperties.default: "var(--n-border-radius-s)] - Controls how rounded the corners are, using [border radius tokens"

cssProperties.name: --n-progress-color
cssProperties.default: "var(--n-color-accent)] - Controls the color of the progress bar, using [color tokens"

The background color of the QR Code.
Can accept any valid CSS color value, including custom properties.

attributes.name: correction
attributes.description:
Error correction level makes the QR Code bigger and helps users to
scan it without issues. L, M, Q and H values will use 7%, 15%, 25%
and 30% of the QR code for error correction respectively.

cssProperties.name: --n-range-track-color-inactive
cssProperties.description: Controls the color of the portion of the track that represents the remaining value.
cssProperties.default: "var(--n-color-border-strong)"

cssProperties.name: --n-range-track-size
cssProperties.description: Controls the height of the track.
cssProperties.default: "3px"

tags.name: nord-select
tags.description:
Select lets users choose one option from an options menu.
Consider using select when you have 5 or more options to choose from.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the component.

attributes.name: hint
attributes.description: Optional hint text to be displayed with the input. Alternatively use the hint slot.

attributes.description: Visually hide the label, but still show it to assistive technologies like screen readers.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Placeholder text to display within the input.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description: Optional error to be shown with the input. Alternatively use the error slot.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description:
Determines whether the input is required or not.
An input marked as required will be announced as such to users of assistive technology.
When using this property you need to also set “novalidate” attribute on a form element to prevent browser from displaying its own validation errors.

attributes.name: hide-required
attributes.description:
Visually hide the required indicator, but still show
required attribute to assistive technologies like screen readers.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Specifies the data type of the field, so that the browser may attempt to fill out the field automatically on behalf of the user.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
Makes the component disabled. This prevents users from
being able to interact with the component, and conveys
its inactive state to assistive technologies.

tags.name: nord-skeleton

Skeletons are used to provide a low fidelity representation of content
before it appears in a view. This improves the perceived loading time
for our users.

tags.name: nord-spinner
tags.description:
Spinner component is used to indicate users that their action is being
processed. You can customize the size and color of the spinner with the
provided properties.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the spinner.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color of the spinner.
Can accept any valid CSS color value, including custom properties.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
An accessible label for the spinner.
If no label is supplied, the spinner is hidden from assistive technology.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the spinner.

properties.name: color
properties.description:
The color of the spinner.
Can accept any valid CSS color value, including custom properties.

properties.name: label
properties.description:
An accessible label for the spinner.
If no label is supplied, the spinner is hidden from assistive technology.

tags.name: nord-stack
tags.description:
Stack component manages layout of immediate children along the
vertical or horizontal axis with optional spacing between each child.

attributes.name: gap
attributes.description: The space injected between components.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: The direction of the stack.

attributes.name: align-items
attributes.description: How to align the child items inside the stack.

attributes.name: responsive
attributes.description: This property is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. We recommend using standard [CSS media queries](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Media_Queries/Using_media_queries) over this property. Please see the [updated usage example](/components/stack/?example=using+responsive+media+query).

attributes.name: wrap
attributes.description:
Defines whether the Stack items are forced in a single line
or can be flowed into multiple lines.

attributes.name: justify-content
attributes.description: How to justify the child items inside the stack.

properties.name: gap
properties.description: The space injected between components.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: The direction of the stack.

properties.name: alignItems
properties.description: How to align the child items inside the stack.

properties.description: This property is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. We recommend using standard [CSS media queries](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Media_Queries/Using_media_queries) over this property. tags.name: nord-table
tags.description:
Table is used to organize and display information from a data set.
Provides table styles in addition to features like sticky
headers and support for narrow viewports.

attributes.name: density
attributes.description:
Controls the density of the table's rows and headers.
Relaxed increases space, condensed reduces space.

attributes.name: scroll-snap
attributes.description: Enables scroll-snapping, meaning the scroll position is always column-aligned.

attributes.name: striped
attributes.description: Controls whether to use zebra striping on tables, which can improve readability.

properties.name: density
properties.description:
Controls the density of the table's rows and headers.
Relaxed increases space, condensed reduces space.

properties.name: scrollSnap
properties.description: Enables scroll-snapping, meaning the scroll position is always column-aligned.

properties.name: striped
properties.description: Controls whether to use zebra striping on tables, which can improve readability.

slots.description: Default slot which holds the HTML `<table>` element.

cssProperties.name: --n-table-td-padding
cssProperties.description: Controls the padding around the table cells.
cssProperties.default: "calc(var(--n-space-m) * 0.95)"

cssProperties.name: --n-table-border-radius
cssProperties.default: "var(--n-border-radius-s)] - Controls how rounded the corners are, using [border radius tokens"

tags.name: nord-textarea
tags.description:
Textarea is a component that allows user to write text over
multiple rows. Used when the expected user input is long.
For shorter input, use the Input component.

attributes.name: resize
attributes.description:
Controls whether the textarea is resizable.
By default is manually resizable vertically.
Set to "auto" to enable auto-resizing as content grows.

attributes.name: expand
attributes.description: Controls whether the textarea expands to fill the width of its container.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: Controls the max allowed length for the textarea.

attributes.name: character-counter
attributes.description:
Controls whether to show a count of the number of characters in the textarea.
When combined with `maxlength`, both the count and the max length are shown.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the component.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Label for the input.

attributes.name: hint
attributes.description: Optional hint text to be displayed with the input. Alternatively use the hint slot.

attributes.name: hide-label
attributes.description: Visually hide the label, but still show it to assistive technologies like screen readers.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Placeholder text to display within the input.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description: Optional error to be shown with the input. Alternatively use the error slot.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description:
Determines whether the input is required or not.
An input marked as required will be announced as such to users of assistive technology.
When using this property you need to also set “novalidate” attribute on a form element to prevent browser from displaying its own validation errors.

attributes.name: hide-required
attributes.description:
Visually hide the required indicator, but still show
required attribute to assistive technologies like screen readers.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Specifies the data type of the field, so that the browser may attempt to fill out the field automatically on behalf of the user.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description:
Makes the component readonly, so that it is not editable.
Readonly differs from disabled in that readonly fields are still focusable and will be submitted with a form.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
Makes the component disabled. This prevents users from
being able to interact with the component, and conveys
its inactive state to assistive technologies.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the form component.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the form component.

tags.name: nord-tooltip
tags.description:
Tooltips are floating containers for displaying additional information
for the currently focused element. A tooltip can be useful when you want
to e.g. give a hint about an existing Command Menu shortcut.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description:
Control the position of the tooltip component.
When set to "none", the tooltip will be shown above
but accommodate for browser boundaries.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: The tooltip role, set on the component by default.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The id for the active element to reference via aria-describedby.

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description: The delay in milliseconds before the tooltip is opened.

but accommodate for browser boundaries.

slots.description: Optional slot that holds shortcut keys to access the subject
